sen.j: 千観（せんかん、延喜18年（918年）- 永観元年12月13日 (旧暦)（984年1月18日））は、平安時代中期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Senkan (918-January 23, 984) was a priest of Tendai Sect in the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 「永観元年12月13日 (旧暦)」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦984年1月23日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Senkan (918-January 23, 984) was a priest of the Tendai Sect in the mid Heian period.
Senkan (918-January 23, 984) was a priest of the Tendai Sect in the mid Heian period.

sen.j: 橘公頼の子・相模守橘敏貞を父とする。
sen.e: His father was Sagami no kami (governor of Sagami Province) TACHIBANA no Toshisada, a child of TACHIBANA no Kimiyori.
His father was TACHIBANA no Toshisada who was the Sagami no Kami (governor of Sagami Province) and child of TACHIBANA no Kimiyori.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more smoothly
sen.e: His father was TACHIBANA no Toshisada who was the Sagami no Kami (governor of Sagami Province) and child of TACHIBANA no Kimiyori.

sen.j: 園城寺に入って出家、受戒。
sen.e: He became a priest at Onjo-ji Temple and received religious precepts.
Senkan entered the priesthood at Onjo-ji Temple and vowed to follow the precepts..
Senkan entered the priesthood at Onjo-ji Temple and received the religious precepts.
sen.cmt: 受戒用語集の表記に従い、vowed to follow the precepts.. をreceived the religious precepts. に修正しました。

sen.j: 行誉（一説によれば運昭）に師事して天台教学を学んだ。
sen.e: He learned about the Tendai Sect under Gyoyo (Unsho according to another account).
He learned about the Tendai Sect under Gyoyo (Unsho according to another account).
He learned about the Tendai Sect under Gyoyo (Unsho according to another account).

sen.j: 後に空也の影響を受けて浄土教へ傾倒し、民衆教化のための和讃としてはじめての阿弥陀和讃をつくった。
sen.e: Afterward, he was influenced by Kuya to be devoted to Jodo (Pure Land) sect and prepared Praise of Amida as the first Wasan (Japanese hymns) for popular edification.
Later on he was influenced by Kuya and devoted himself to the Jodo (Pure Land) sect and prepared the "Praise of Amida" as the first Wasan (Japanese hymn) to educate the masses.
sen.cmt: "popular edification" was not easy for me to understand, so I changed "民衆教化" to "educate the masses"
sen.e: Later on he was influenced by Kuya and devoted himself to the Jodo (Pure Land) sect and prepared the "Praise of Amida" as the first Wasan (Japanese hymn) to educate the masses.

sen.j: 962年（応和2年）に摂津国箕面山に隠遁して浄土行の生活を送った。
sen.e: He started to live in Mt. Mino, Settsu Province in retirement in 962 and trained himself in Jodo practices.
In 962, he secluded himself on Mt. Mino in the Settsu Province and trained in Jodo practices.
sen.cmt: For "隠遁" I changed from "retirement" to "secluded himself"
sen.e: In 962, he secluded himself on Mt. Mino in the Settsu Province and trained in Jodo practices.

sen.j: 963年（応和3年）勅命により祈雨を祈願し奇瑞を現したという。
sen.e: In 963, he prayed for rain by an Imperial order and reportedly made Kizui (auspicious omen) happen.
By imperial command in 963, he prayed for rain and allegedly made a Kizui (auspicious omen) occur.
sen.cmt: reportedly→allegedly; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: By imperial command in 963, he prayed for rain and allegedly made a Kizui (auspicious omen) occur.

sen.j: 応和宗論の論者として選ばれたが辞退し、摂津国金龍寺 (高槻市)（安満寺）を再興してそこに住した。
sen.e: Although he was selected as a debater for Owa shuron debate, he refused to accept it, and he revived Konryu-ji Temple in Settsu Province (Takatsuki City) (Ama-dera Temple), where he lived in.
Senkan was selected to debate for discourses on Owa Shuron, but declined the offer and went to revive the Konryu-ji Temple in the Settsu Province (Takatsuki City) (Ama-dera Temple) where he lived.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Senkan was selected to debate for discourses on Owa Shuron, but declined the offer and went to revive the Konryu-ji Temple in the Settsu Province (Takatsuki City) (Ama-dera Temple) where he lived.

sen.j: 970年（天禄元年）行誉から三部大法を伝授されている。
sen.e: He was instructed on three divisions of the great pantheon from Gyoyo in 970.
In 970 he was initiated by Gyoyo on the three divisions of the great pantheon.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In 970 he was initiated by Gyoyo on the three divisions of the great pantheon.

sen.j: 常に念仏者の規範である八誓十願の教えを広め、浄土教の信者集団を作った。
sen.e: He always tried to spread Hassei Jugan teachings which was the standard for Nenbutsu (Buddhist invocation) devotees and formed Jodo-sect-believer groups.
sen.cmt: 「八誓十願」は、読み方が不明で、常識的と思われる読み方をローマ字化しました。
sen.e: He was always spreading the Hassei Jugan teachings, which were the standard for Nenbutsu (Buddhist invocation) devotees, and formed Jodo-sect-believer groups.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: He was always spreading the Hassei Jugan teachings, which were the standard for Nenbutsu (Buddhist invocation) devotees, and formed Jodo-sect-believer groups.
